solverGMRES_el.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : solverGMRES_el.c                                                *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * It performs the iterative solving of the linear system using GMRES.         *
00009 * size        : d.o.f of the problem.                                         *
00010 * MAX_ITERS   : max. iterations in the outer loop.                            *
00011 * tolerance   : the convergence criteria.                                     *
00012 * x           : initial guess and also the solution returned by GMRES.        *
00013 * convergence : converged solution (0) or not converged solution (1)          *
00014 * preCond     : use Jacobi preconditioner (1) or not (0)                      *
00015 ******************************************************************************/
00016

00040 #include "solverGMRES_el.h"
00041 
00042 void solverGMRES_el(unsigned int preCond, unsigned int nInit, double **A, 
00043                     double *B)
00044 {
00045     FILE *fin;
00046     unsigned int i, iter1 = 0, iter2 = 0, j, convergence = 1, size;
00047     double tolerance = 1.0, buffer, diag;
00048     double *x;
00049 
00050     fg = fopen("gmres.log","w");
00051     size = 2*nNodes;
00052     x = doubleVector(size,1);
00053     
00054     if(nInit != 0){
00055         fin = fopen("solution.init","r");
00056         for(i = 0; i < nInit; i++) fscanf(fin,"%le",&x[i]);
00057         fclose(fin);
00058     }
00059     
00060     /* Use Jacobi Preconditioner */
00061     if(preCond == 1){
00062         for(i = 0; i < nNodes; i++){
00063             diag = 1.0/A[i][i];
00064             B[i] = B[i]*diag;
00065             for(j = 0; j < size; j++) A[i][j] = diag*A[i][j];
00066         }
00067     }
00068     
00069     /* Set the tolerance w.r.t. the magnitute of the B */
00070     tolerance = L2Norm(size,B)*TOLERANCE;
00071 
00072     /* Printing the convergence performance of the solution progress */
00073     fprintf(fg,"\n\nRELATIVE TOLERANCE = %10.4e\n", tolerance);
00074     fprintf(fg,"\n%10s%21s\n", "ITER #    ", "RELATIVE RESIDUAL");
00075     fprintf(fg,"%10s%21s\n", "***************", "*******************");
00076         
00077     /* Iterations starts */
00078     for(i = 1; i <= MAX_OUTER_LOOP; i++){
00079         iter1++;
00080         iter2 = 0;
00081         
00082         /* Solving the linear system here */
00083         convergence = iterGMRES_el(size,iter1,&iter2,tolerance,A,x,B);
00084 
00085         if(convergence == 0){
00086             fprintf(fg,"\n\n***PROBLEM CONVERGES IN %d ITERATIONS***\n\n", MAX_ITERS*(iter1-1)+iter2);
00087     
00088             /* Return solution in B */    
00089             for(i = 0; i < size; i++) B[i] = x[i];
00090             free(x);
00091             break;
00092         }
00093     }   
00094         
00095     if(convergence == 1){
00096         fprintf(fg,"Problem fails to vonverge to given tolerance in %d iterations\n\n",MAX_OUTER_LOOP*MAX_ITERS);
00097         errorHandler("Linear system may be ill-conditioned");
00098     }
00099     fclose(fg);    
00100 }
